message: Let's start with a fair deal. I'll take 90% and you get 10%. We can negotiate further in the next rounds if you don't like this offer.
Your cut effectively decreases each round with inflation. I propose a more reasonable split, considering the future rounds.
I understand inflation is a factor, but your offer is too lopsided. Let's compromise: I'll take 70% and you get 30%. We still have time to work out a better deal if this doesn't suit you.
Time is running out, and our money is losing value. I'm aiming for a more balanced outcome. Let's settle this before the inflation hurts us both further.
We're both losing money with each round. I'm willing to go down to 60% if you're willing to meet me halfway. Let's not let our stubbornness cost us more.
Alice, this is a serious offer.  The inflation is working against you more than me.  Let's be reasonable and split this fairly while it's still worthwhile.
We're getting closer! I'm dropping down to 55%, but I need you to meet me halfway on this.  The longer we wait, the less we both get.
